question_sentence: What quintessential British vehicle is being used in Ukraine’s war effort?
evidence: Three UK bendy buses have arrived in Ukraine to function as “rest areas for beleaguered troops”, according to The Telegraph. The purple buses, still bearing their Luton Airport logos, will also transport supplies and soldiers. For more unexpected stories, sign up to our Tall Tales newsletter.

question_sentence: Which French stadium will host the final of the men’s Rugby World Cup?
evidence: The tournament opens today when hosts France play three-times winners New Zealand at Stade de France on the outskirts of Paris, which will also host the final on 28 October. For predictions and odds, read our in-depth guide to this year’s tournament.

question_sentence: The latest data shows that abortion rates in Scotland increased by how much between 2021 and 2022?
evidence: The number of women aged 16 to 19 accessing abortions in Scotland in 2021-22 rose to its highest level since data was first published in 2013. Experts have said that social media misinformation and the cost-of-living crisis contributed to the record-high figures.

question_sentence: A new black comedy by controversial 90-year-old director Roman Polanski that premiered at the Venice Film Festival is called what?
evidence: Roman Polanski’s “name as a filmmaker is in the toilet”, said the Evening Standard, after “The Palace” was widely lambasted. Its inclusion at the Venice Film Festival had already sparked a backlash, as Polanski is still a fugitive from US justice after raping a 13-year-old girl in 1977. Find out more in The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: India’s invitations for the G20 summit this weekend sparked rumours that the country might be preparing to change its name to what?
evidence: G20 hosts India have reportedly invited world leaders to join the “President of Bharat” for dinner at the summit in Delhi this weekend, sparking rumours that Narendra Modi’s nationalist government could be preparing to change the country’s name in a bid to break with the colonial past.

question_sentence: The UK’s bees are in danger from which invasive species, according to a new report?
evidence: Asian hornets are “wreaking havoc” in mainland Europe, according to a new report by leading scientists. There has been a sharp spike in sightings, with nests found in Sussex, Kent, Devon and Dorset, said the BBC, raising fears of “catastrophic consequences” for the UK’s bee populations.

question_sentence: Ukraine’s battlefield forces are communicating via Elon Musk’s Starlink network, which has how many satellites in orbit?
evidence: Pentagon officials have voiced unease over their reliance on Musk and his companies after the US Department of Defense signed a contract for SpaceX to provide Starlink satellite services for Ukraine. Starlink’s network now accounts for more than half of all active satellites.

question_sentence: Which cabinet minister now has the highest approval rating from Tory members following Ben Wallace’s resignation as defence minister?
evidence: The business secretary now tops the ConservativeHome rankings, with a “net satisfaction” rating of +59, replacing Wallace, who had “farewell total of 76 points”. Penny Mordaunt is in second place on +47.5, ahead of James Cleverly on +43.9, with Rishi Sunak down in 25th place, with -3.8 points.

question_sentence: Scientists believe they have found the answer to high levels of radioactivity in which wild European animal?
evidence: Persistently high levels of radioactivity in Central Europe’s wild boars have long baffled scientists, as they have declined in other animals since the 1986 Chernobyl nuclear disaster. But a new study published in the Environmental Science & Technology journal appears to have solved the “wild boar paradox”.

question_sentence: According to latest Halifax data, UK house prices fell by how much year-on-year in August?
evidence: The drop is the biggest year-on-year decrease since 2009. Rival lender Nationwide last week put the drop at 5.3%, as homeowners and potential buyers face persistently high interest rates.

question_sentence: Which state deployed more than 200 law enforcement personnel this week to capture an escaped prisoner?
evidence: Convicted murderer Danelo Cavalcante escaped a Pennsylvania prison on August 31, sparking a dayslong manhunt. The search for him unnerved residents statewide who were warned that he was extremely dangerous.

question_sentence: Thousands of people were recently stranded at which festival?
evidence: Around 70,000 Burning Man attendees were stranded in the Nevada desert following intense rain and muddy conditions.

question_sentence: Approximately 4 million people have so far enrolled in President Biden’s new student loan repayment plan. What is the program called?
evidence: Biden’s new repayment plan, known as SAVE (Saving on a Valuable Education), promises to lower borrowers’ monthly bills as student loan payments are set to resume in October.

question_sentence: What is the name of the potentially dangerous storm approaching the Caribbean this weekend?
evidence: Forecasts show that the potentially dangerous Hurricane Lee in the Atlantic will pass to the north of the Leeward Islands, the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico this weekend.

question_sentence: Which day this week marked the unofficial end of summer?
evidence: Labor Day on Monday marked the unofficial end of summer for many in the US — but forecasts show that July-like heat will continue building across several states in the coming weeks.

question_sentence: Which professional sports league is back this week for its 104th season?
evidence: After an almost six-month break, the National Football League (NFL) picked up again this week with regular season games.

question_sentence: As the war in Ukraine grinds toward another winter, Russia may be looking to which country to replenish its ammunition?
evidence: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un may travel to Russia to meet President Vladimir Putin for discussions on a potential deal to supply Moscow with weapons for its war on Ukraine, according to the US government.

question_sentence: Which political figure tested positive for Covid-19 this week?
evidence: First lady Jill Biden tested positive for Covid-19 this week and is experiencing “mild symptoms,” the White House said. President Joe Biden has tested negative.

question_sentence: Which state was ordered by a federal judge this week to remove floating barriers on Rio Grande aimed at deterring migrants?
evidence: Texas was ordered to remove the migrant barriers in the Rio Grande by September 15. The buoys have been a contentious issue since they were deployed in the river as part of Gov. Greg Abbott’s border security initiative known as Operation Lone Star. A federal appeals court has since issued a stay allowing the barriers to remain for now.

question_sentence: Which player has sparked a surge in Major League Soccer ticket sales and streaming subscriptions?
evidence: Soccer superstar Leo Messi’s arrival in America has sparked a surge in ticket prices, apparel, and now, Apple’s MLS Season Pass streaming package that broadcasts the soccer matches.

question_sentence: Which reality TV dating show featured Chelsea Griffin and Kwame Appiah, who recently visited Delaware?
In which Netflix anime series does Aubrey Plaza voice the character Julie Powers?
What is the title of the exhibition at Winterthur Museum, Garden & Library that celebrates the legacy of fashion designer Ann Lowe?
choices: "The Crown and Downton Abbey: A Fashion Extravaganza"
"Unsung Heroes of Fashion: A Tribute to Ann Lowe"

question_sentence: By what percentage will Delmarva Power decrease its supply charges for gas customers beginning in November?
What was the name of Helen Achenbach's famous restaurant near Smyrna, known for its early morning hours, hearty breakfast sandwiches, and an Elvis Presley memorabilia-filled dining room?
What is the estimated value of the painting that the woman found in a New Hampshire thrift store, believed to be the work of American master N.C. Wyeth?
How did Danelo Souza Cavalcante escape from the Chester County prison?
choices: By scaling a wall of the exercise yard and running across the roof

question_sentence: What did the NAACP call for in response to the officer-involved shooting of Tremaine Jackson?
choices: Greater police transparency and the release of video footage
Increased funding for police body cameras

question_sentence: Why did Sanjay Bhatnagar receive recognition as one of Delaware's top lawyers shortly after losing his lawsuit appeal against New Castle County?
choices: It was a coincidence unrelated to his lawsuit.
The county attorney's office nominated him for the award.
The award was given to him to compensate for his legal fees.

question_sentence: What is the new COVID-19 variant detected in Delaware called?
